ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Dungeon Fighting
ygData.msgSnippet: You can use a pet if you keep a tigh leash on it. Make social buttons for /pet get lost, /pet attack, and /pet back off. You should be just fine if you pay
ygData.messageBody:
You can use a pet if you keep a tigh leash on it. Make social buttons for
/pet get lost, /pet attack, and /pet back off. You should be just fine if
you pay attention to what your doing.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Marlon Clark <marlonclark@...>
To: EQ_Necromancer@egroups.com <EQ_Necromancer@egroups.com>
Date: Tuesday, May 02, 2000 8:36 PM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Dungeon Fighting


>Hi,
>
>I have some questions about adventuring in a
>dungeon. I have been told not to bring a pet
>into a dungeon because it was dangerous. I
>assume this is because the pet will chase
>foes running away and cause trains. Is this
>true?
>
>Also, if I can't bring a pet, how do I fight
>in the dungeon? Are my soloing days over and
>I have to join a group?
>
>Marlon
